questions.question: What is the chemical formula for silver(I) tricyanomethanide?
What property does silver(I) tricyanomethanide exhibit under hydrostatic compression?
What is the significance of negative area compressibility in materials?
questions.answer: It allows materials to expand in two orthogonal directions under hydrostatic pressure, which is useful for developing artificial muscles, nanoscale actuators, and high-performance pressure sensors.

questions.question: How does the crystal structure of Ag(tcm) contribute to its negative area compressibility?
questions.answer: The crystal structure consists of stacked, doubly-interpenetrating honeycomb-like layers, where pressure-driven collapse of the interlayer separation couples with a reduction in layer rippling, increasing the layer cross-sectional area.

questions.question: What experimental techniques were used to investigate the properties of Ag(tcm)?
questions.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction and variable-pressure neutron diffraction.

questions.question: True or False: Ag(tcm) exhibits isotropic area compressibility within the entire (a,c) plane.
What potential applications are suggested for Ag(tcm) due to its unique properties?
questions.answer: Ultra-high-precision sensing devices, piezoelectric and thermoelectric devices.

questions.question: True or False: The phenomenon of negative compressibility is common among conventional engineering materials.
What is the role of layer rippling in the mechanism of negative area compressibility in Ag(tcm)?
questions.answer: Layer rippling decreases under compression, which acts to increase the layer cross-sectional area, contributing to negative area compressibility.

questions.question: True or False: The negative area compressibility of Ag(tcm) is weaker than the positive area compressibility of traditional engineering materials.
